items.headline: A partial shutdown has hit. TSA is warning of long waits and missed or delayed flights.
items.summary_en: A partial U.S. government shutdown is underway Saturday, after the House and Senate left Washington earlier this week without providing full funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘We have no prenup’: I want rights of survivorship in our marital home. My wife prefers tenants in common. Now what?
items.summary_en: “She is an old-school farm girl who inherited all her money and wants to pass it down to her children.”

items.headline: The stock market is reflecting fears of an AI apocalypse for white-collar jobs
items.summary_en: Investors are shooting first and asking questions later as the momentum trade gets swept up by concerns that AI could disrupt established industries like insurance and wealth management.

items.headline: How the riptide around AI and stocks could seep into Fed decisions and the housing market
items.summary_en: AI is suddenly driving big swings in stocks. It also could seep into central-bank policy decisions and the U.S. housing market.

items.headline: U.S. economy suddenly seems on track for fabled soft landing: 2% inflation without a recession
items.summary_en: Who needs interest-rate cuts when the labor market is looking healthy and inflation is cooling?

items.headline: ‘We’ve been dating for 5 years’: My boyfriend’s parents say he doesn’t earn enough to marry. Should I speak to his father?
items.summary_en: “Every year his very wealthy parents say that he needs to ‘earn more’ before he can marry me.”

items.headline: Crypto investors who don’t fill out this new tax form the right way could overpay on their taxes

items.headline: ‘I’m part of a blended family that didn’t blend well’: My stepsister added her mailing address to our mother’s bank account. Can she be trusted?
